original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyud dang / tshul rmongs pa med par khong du chud pa kun tu bzang po'i ting nge 'dzin brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa la rnam par rtse zhing spyod pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyud dang / tshul rmongs pa med par khong du chud pa kun tu bzang po'i ting nge 'dzin brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa la rnam par rtse zhing spyod pa /
translated: They had realized the inconceivable samādhi of Samantabhadra, which is beyond words.

original: seng ge bsgyings pa'i ye shes kyi grub pa la shin tu gnas pa /
analyzed: seng ge bsgyings pa'i ye shes kyi grub pa la shin tu gnas pa /
translated: They had attained the wisdom of the lion’s sport.🔽They were free from attachment to mind, mentality, and consciousness.

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa la chags pa med pa rnams kyi chos kyi bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa rab tu yangs pa chen po bcu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa la chags pa med pa rnams kyi chos kyi bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa rab tu yangs pa chen po bcu 'byung ngo //
translated: They had ten vast and superior intentions and aspirations.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What were those ten?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas thams cad rjes su dran pas gnas pa yin /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas thams cad rjes su dran pas gnas pa yin /
translated: They were: the bodhisattvas’ recollection of all the buddhas;

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid tshad med pas gnas pa yin /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid tshad med pas gnas pa yin /
translated: They abide in the immeasurable suchness of all phenomena.

original: sems can thams cad gdul ba'i snying rje chen pos gnas pa yin /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gdul ba'i snying rje chen pos gnas pa yin /
translated: They abide in great compassion, which is to guide all sentient beings.

original: zhing rnam par dag pa'i gnas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir gnas pa rnam par dag pas gnas pa yin /
analyzed: zhing rnam par dag pa'i gnas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir gnas pa rnam par dag pas gnas pa yin /
translated: They abide in pure abodes because the purity of their realms is inconceivable.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul la mos pa rnam par dag pas gnas pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul la mos pa rnam par dag pas gnas pa yin /
translated: They abide in pure devotion to the domain of the blessed buddhas.

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub tha dad par mi byed pas gnas pa yin /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub tha dad par mi byed pas gnas pa yin /
translated: They abide in the non-differentiation of the enlightenment of all the buddhas of the past, present, and future.

original: chags pa med pa'i mtha' bsgribs pa med pas chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin mtshan nyid med pas gnas pa yin /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i mtha' bsgribs pa med pas chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin mtshan nyid med pas gnas pa yin /
translated: They abide in the nature, essence, and characteristics of all phenomena, which are unobscured by the limitless absence of attachment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'das pa dang / ma byung ba dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pas gnas pa yin /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i 'phrin las @322a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'das pa dang / ma byung ba dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pas gnas pa yin / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i 'phrin las @322a *//
translated: They abide in the roots of virtue of all the tathāgatas, past, future, and present, and in the way of the continuum of the one.

original: dang; gsung gi 'phrin las dang / thugs kyi 'phrin las 'das pa dang / ma byung ba dang / da ltar byung ba chags pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings shin tu ston pa'i ye shes sngon du 'gro bas gnas pa yin /
analyzed: dang; gsung gi 'phrin las dang / thugs kyi 'phrin las 'das pa dang / ma byung ba dang / da ltar byung ba chags pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings shin tu ston pa'i ye shes sngon du 'gro bas gnas pa yin /
translated: They abide in the past, future, and present activity of body, speech, and mind of all the tathāgatas, and in the wisdom that teaches the unattached realm of phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad kyi skye ba dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / snying po byang chub tu gshegs pa dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad kyi skye ba dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / snying po byang chub tu gshegs pa dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang /
translated: They abide in the birth, renunciation, going to the Bodhimaṇḍa, enlightenment, turning the wheel of the Dharma, and parinirvāṇa of all the tathāgatas, past, future, and present.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dus gsum mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pa skad cig gcig gis mthar 'jug pas gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dus gsum mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pa skad cig gcig gis mthar 'jug pas gnas pa yin te /
translated: They are the state of abiding in the realization of the equality of the three times of the completely perfect transcendence of suffering, and in the instantaneous engagement in the ultimate.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa de dag ni tshad med pa /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa de dag ni tshad med pa /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas’ superior intent is immeasurable,

original: shin tu yangs pa /🔽bgrang du med pa /🔽gzhal du med pa /
analyzed: shin tu yangs pa / bgrang du med pa / gzhal du med pa /
translated: vast,🔽incalculable,🔽incomparable,

original: zad mi shes pa /
analyzed: zad mi shes pa /
translated: inexhaustible,

original: brjod par dka' ba /
analyzed: brjod par dka' ba /
translated: difficult to express,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: inconceivable,

original: brjod du med pa /
analyzed: brjod du med pa /
translated: inexpressible,

original: bzod par dka' ba /
analyzed: bzod par dka' ba /
translated: difficult to bear,

original: 'gro ba thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa dag ste /
translated: and unassailable by any being.

original: chos thams cad kyi ye shes rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ye shes rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to accomplish the wisdom of all phenomena,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de lhag pa'i bsam pa de lta bus gnas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de lhag pa'i bsam pa de lta bus gnas so //
translated: the bodhisattvas abide with such superior intent.

original: de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa yin te /
translated: Through these, the bodhisattvas attain the perfection of the bodhisattva Samantabhadra’s conduct

original: chos rnam par dag pa yang rab tu thob bo //
analyzed: chos rnam par dag pa yang rab tu thob bo //
translated: and also attain the purity of phenomena.

original: bsam pa'i stobs kyang rnam par 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: bsam pa'i stobs kyang rnam par 'phel bar byed do //
translated: and the power of thought increases.

original: sems can rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pa yang yang @322b dag par ston to //
analyzed: sems can rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pa yang yang @322b dag par ston to //
translated: He shows the roots of virtue to sentient beings without measure.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyang rnam par 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyang rnam par 'phel bar byed do //
translated: The power of the bodhisattva increases.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan mi khom pa khom par byed pa thams cad kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan mi khom pa khom par byed pa thams cad kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects all the bodhisattva qualities that make the unfavorable favorable.

original: shin tu 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shin tu 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to be completely free,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad yongs su grub pa yang rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad yongs su grub pa yang rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: he attains the perfection of all bodhisattva conduct.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi gzungs kyis 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bstan pa yang dag par 'dzin to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi gzungs kyis 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bstan pa yang dag par 'dzin to //
translated: By the Dharma dhāraṇī of all buddhas, he upholds the teachings of all buddhas of the past, present, and future.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mthar sems can gyi khams thams cad la yang dag par lta'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mthar sems can gyi khams thams cad la yang dag par lta'o //
translated: He looks upon the realm of sentient beings with a mind that is free from desire.

original: tshig gi lam gyi rgyud kyis sems can thams cad 'dul ba yongs su ston to //
analyzed: tshig gi lam gyi rgyud kyis sems can thams cad 'dul ba yongs su ston to //
translated: He manifests the taming of all sentient beings through the continuum of verbal expression.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de ni ting nge 'dzin rgya chen po de lta bu thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos nyid de /
analyzed: de ni ting nge 'dzin rgya chen po de lta bu thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos nyid de /
translated: This is the nature of bodhisattvas who have attained such vast meditative concentration.

original: des byang chub sems dpa' de sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'byams klas pa thams cad la mchog tu bya ba rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: des byang chub sems dpa' de sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'byams klas pa thams cad la mchog tu bya ba rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: By means of that, the bodhisattva attains the supreme state of all the infinite wisdoms of the buddhas.

original: de'i phyir chos 'byams klas pa thams cad ston pa la mkhas pa'i tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos 'byams klas pa thams cad ston pa la mkhas pa'i tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: Therefore, he attains the correct understanding of skill in teaching all the infinite dharmas.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad du chos kyi dam pa 'jigs pa med par rnam par dag pa rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad du chos kyi dam pa 'jigs pa med par rnam par dag pa rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: Therefore, he attains the pure, fearless, supreme dharma in all worlds.

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i ye shes rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i ye shes rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: Therefore, he attains the wisdom that follows all meditative concentrations.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i tshul thams cad la mkhas pa'i dam pa rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i tshul thams cad la mkhas pa'i dam pa rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: Therefore, he attains the supreme skill in all the bodhisattva ways.

original: de'i phyir tshul thams cad kyi rgyan rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul thams cad kyi rgyan rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: Therefore, he obtains the ornament of all the ways.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad du chos kyi dbugs phyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad du chos kyi dbugs phyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, he becomes endowed with the perfection of the Dharma-wind for all worlds.

original: @323a *// de'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi dus dang dus ma yin pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: @323a *// de'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi dus dang dus ma yin pa rab tu shes so //
translated: Therefore, he knows the right and wrong times for all sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bar bya ba rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bar bya ba rab tu shes so //
translated: Therefore, he knows how to illuminate all world systems.

original: de'i phyir sems can thams cad la bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can thams cad la bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, he penetrates unobstructed wisdom for all sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir don thams cad bsgrub par yon tan thams cad la yan lag rab tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir don thams cad bsgrub par yon tan thams cad la yan lag rab tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, he is established in all the branches of good qualities in order to accomplish all goals.

original: de'i phyir theg pa'i dam pa rab tu brtson par byas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir theg pa'i dam pa rab tu brtson par byas te /
translated: Therefore, he exerts himself in the highest vehicle.

original: sems can thams cad la mnyam par gzhag pa rnam par dag pa rab tu brjod do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la mnyam par gzhag pa rnam par dag pa rab tu brjod do //
translated: He proclaims the purity of meditative concentration for all sentient beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don la gnas pa /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don la gnas pa /
translated: It is the bodhisattvas who are intent on the welfare of beings,

original: snying rje chen po de lta bu rnam par 'phel bar byed pa /
analyzed: snying rje chen po de lta bu rnam par 'phel bar byed pa /
translated: who increase such great compassion,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bsten par 'dod pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bsten par 'dod pa /
translated: who wish to rely on spiritual friends,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad blta bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad blta bar 'dod pa /
translated: who wish to see all the buddhas,🔽who wish to illuminate all phenomena,

original: chos thams cad snang bar bya bar 'dod pa; zhing thams cad du 'gro bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad snang bar bya bar 'dod pa; zhing thams cad du 'gro bar 'dod pa /
translated: who wish to go to all realms,

original: phyogs thams cad du rgyu bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: phyogs thams cad du rgyu bar 'dod pa /
translated: who wish to travel to all directions,

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid khong du chud par 'dod pa /
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid khong du chud par 'dod pa /
translated: who wish to understand the sameness of the three times,

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa /
translated: who wish to attain the sameness of all phenomena,

original: sangs rgyas mnyam pa nyid la rab tu gnas par 'dod pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mnyam pa nyid la rab tu gnas par 'dod pa /
translated: who wish to abide in the sameness of the buddhas,

original: ye shes mnyam pa nyid la 'dug par 'dod pas chos 'di dag la las de lta bur brtson zhing las gzhan med pa dang / ngoms mi shes pa dang / sems ma 'khrugs pa dang / yid rtse gcig tu gyur pa dang / de ltar gnas pa la brtson pa dang /
analyzed: ye shes mnyam pa nyid la 'dug par 'dod pas chos 'di dag la las de lta bur brtson zhing las gzhan med pa dang / ngoms mi shes pa dang / sems ma 'khrugs pa dang / yid rtse gcig tu gyur pa dang / de ltar gnas pa la brtson pa dang /
translated: “Those who wish to rest in the sameness of wisdom should apply themselves to these teachings in this way, without any other activity, without being satisfied, without a disturbed mind, with a one-pointed mind, and with diligence in remaining in this way.

original: de ltar khong du chud pa'i yid dang / de ltar mnyam @323b pa'i sems dang / de lta bu'i yid bde ba dang / de ltar las su rung ba dang / de ltar brtson pa dang / de ltar mthar 'byin pa dang / de ltar rnam par spyod pas nan tan du bya zhing mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar khong du chud pa'i yid dang / de ltar mnyam @323b pa'i sems dang / de lta bu'i yid bde ba dang / de ltar las su rung ba dang / de ltar brtson pa dang / de ltar mthar 'byin pa dang / de ltar rnam par spyod pas nan tan du bya zhing mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: With a mind that has understood in this way, with a mind that is the same in this way, with a mind that is happy in this way, with a mind that is flexible in this way, with diligence in this way, with accomplishment in this way, and with conduct in this way, they should practice and accomplish.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni log par smra ba ma yin /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni log par smra ba ma yin /
translated: Why is that?🔽Bodhisattvas do not speak falsely.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gzhan du smra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gzhan du smra ba ma yin te /
translated: Bodhisattvas do not speak in a way that is different from the truth.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ji skad du smras pa de bzhin du byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ji skad du smras pa de bzhin du byed pa'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas do what they say they will do.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / rdo rje ni gcig tu mi rung bar brjod pa ste /
analyzed: dper na / rdo rje ni gcig tu mi rung bar brjod pa ste /
translated: A diamond is said to be indivisible,

original: mi tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: mi tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: and it does not give up its nature of being hard.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang chos 'di dag las brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang chos 'di dag las brjod pa ste /
translated: In the same way, a bodhisattva is said to be indivisible from these dharmas,

original: 'di lta bu'i chos la gnas pa yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i chos la gnas pa yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: and he does not give up his state of being in these dharmas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / gser ni kha dog shin tu bzang bar brjod pa ste /
analyzed: dper na / gser ni kha dog shin tu bzang bar brjod pa ste /
translated: Gold is said to be of excellent color,

original: gser gyi kha dog bzang po rnam par dag pa yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: gser gyi kha dog bzang po rnam par dag pa yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: and it does not give up its pure, excellent color.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang de ltar dge zhing bzang ba'i chos kyis brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang de ltar dge zhing bzang ba'i chos kyis brjod pa ste /
translated: In the same way, a bodhisattva is said to be of excellent, wholesome dharmas,

original: de ltar dge zhing bzang ba'i chos la gnas pa yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar dge zhing bzang ba'i chos la gnas pa yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: and he does not give up his state of being in excellent, wholesome dharmas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / lha'i bu nyi ma ni snang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis brjod pa ste /
analyzed: dper na / lha'i bu nyi ma ni snang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis brjod pa ste /
translated: The son of the gods, Sūrya, is said to be the orb of light,

original: snang ba yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: snang ba yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: and he does not give up his light.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'gro ba thams cad du snang bas brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'gro ba thams cad du snang bas brjod pa ste /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva is said to be the light of all beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i snang ba yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i snang ba yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva does not abandon the light of the bodhisattva.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / ri'i rgyal po ri rab ni rin po che bzhi'i phung pos rgya mtsho las shin tu 'phags par @324a *//🔽brjod pa ste /
analyzed: dper na / ri'i rgyal po ri rab ni rin po che bzhi'i phung pos rgya mtsho las shin tu 'phags par @324a *// brjod pa ste /
translated: Mount Meru, the king of mountains, is said to be above the ocean because of the mass of the four precious substances.

original: rgya mtsho las shin tu 'phags pa yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: rgya mtsho las shin tu 'phags pa yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: It is said that it is above the ocean and does not abandon that.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig rten thams cad las dge ba'i rtsa bas shin tu 'phags par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig rten thams cad las dge ba'i rtsa bas shin tu 'phags par brjod pa ste /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva is said to be above all worlds because of the roots of virtue.

original: 'jig rten thams cad las shin tu 'phags pa yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad las shin tu 'phags pa yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: It is said that he is above all worlds and does not abandon that.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / sa chen po ni 'gro ba thams cad yongs su rton par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: dper na / sa chen po ni 'gro ba thams cad yongs su rton par brjod pa ste /
translated: The great earth is said to be the support of all beings.

original: rton pa'i rang bzhin yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: rton pa'i rang bzhin yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: It is said that it is the support and does not abandon that.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'gro ba thams cad yongs su 'grel bar brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'gro ba thams cad yongs su 'grel bar brjod pa ste /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva is said to be the liberator of all beings,

original: snying rje chen po yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: snying rje chen po yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: but he does not abandon great compassion.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / rgya mtsho chen po ni rin po che thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su brjod pa ste /
analyzed: dper na / rgya mtsho chen po ni rin po che thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su brjod pa ste /
translated: The great ocean is said to be the source of all jewels,

original: rgya mtsho'i chu yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i chu yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: but it does not abandon the water of the ocean.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su brjod pa ste /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva is said to be the source of all roots of virtue,

original: sems can thams cad yongs su dgrol ba'i smon lam yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su dgrol ba'i smon lam yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: but he does not abandon the aspiration to liberate all beings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / 'phong gi slob dpon ni mda' gzhu dang 'phong la zo bdog bde bas ji srid du mda' gzhu dang ldan zhing mda' gzhu la brtson pas brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: dper na / 'phong gi slob dpon ni mda' gzhu dang 'phong la zo bdog bde bas ji srid du mda' gzhu dang ldan zhing mda' gzhu la brtson pas brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: The master of archery is said to be skilled in the use of the bow and arrow,

original: 'phong gi tshul du bya ba yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: 'phong gi tshul du bya ba yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: but he does not abandon the practice of archery.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang ji tsam du ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang; yul gyi rnam pa 'di lta bu la mngon par brtson zhing yongs su sgrub pa de tsam du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis snang bar 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang ji tsam du ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang; yul gyi rnam pa 'di lta bu la mngon par brtson zhing yongs su sgrub pa de tsam du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis snang bar 'gyur ba yin /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva, to the extent that he is intent on and accomplishes such a domain of the aspects of concentration, to that extent does he become illuminated by the knowledge of omniscience.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i @324b rgyal po ni ji tsam du tshe ring ba de tsam du bde ba myong ba yin /
analyzed: dper na / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i @324b rgyal po ni ji tsam du tshe ring ba de tsam du bde ba myong ba yin /
translated: for example, the universal monarch, to the extent that he lives long, to that extent does he experience happiness.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang ji tsam du byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin chen po la snyoms par 'jug pa de tsam du sems can gyi khams rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang ji tsam du byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin chen po la snyoms par 'jug pa de tsam du sems can gyi khams rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva, to the extent that he practices the bodhisattva way of life and enters into such a great concentration, to that extent does he purify the realm of sentient beings.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa yang rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa yang rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: He attains the most excellent purification.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / ji tsam du sa bon btab pa de tsam du rnam par 'phel lo //
analyzed: dper na / ji tsam du sa bon btab pa de tsam du rnam par 'phel lo //
translated: for example, to the extent that seeds are sown, to that extent do they grow.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang ji tsam du byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la brtson pa de tsam du sems can gyi khams rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang ji tsam du byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la brtson pa de tsam du sems can gyi khams rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the more the bodhisattva strives in the conduct of the bodhisattva Samantabhadra, the more the realms of sentient beings become purified in terms of their roots of virtue.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / sprin chen po ni ji tsam du char 'bebs pa de tsam du dbyar gyi dus la sa bon rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / sprin chen po ni ji tsam du char 'bebs pa de tsam du dbyar gyi dus la sa bon rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the more a great cloud rains, the more the seeds in the rainy season grow.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang ji tsam du chos kyi sprin gyi char 'bebs shing /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang ji tsam du chos kyi sprin gyi char 'bebs shing /
translated: In the same way, the more the bodhisattva rains down the cloud of Dharma

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa dang / rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin chen po la snyoms par 'jug pa de tsam du sems can rnams shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa dang / rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin chen po la snyoms par 'jug pa de tsam du sems can rnams shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: and practices the conduct of the bodhisattva, and the more he enters into such a great samādhi, the more sentient beings become extremely pure.

original: shin tu mthar thug par 'gyur ba dang / shin tu bde ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / mchog tu bya ba shin tu 'thob pa dang / shin tu pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad shin tu tshim par byed pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu mthar thug par 'gyur ba dang / shin tu bde ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / mchog tu bya ba shin tu 'thob pa dang / shin tu pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad shin tu tshim par byed pa dang /
translated: It is the ultimate perfection, the supreme perfection, the perfection of the highest, the perfection of the ultimate, the perfection that satisfies all worlds,

original: skye dgu thams cad kyi bya ba thams cad la the tshom shin tu gcod pa dang / sbyin bsreg yongs su bzung zhing sbyin pa yongs su sbyong bas bsod nams rmad du byung ba dang / phyir @325a *//
analyzed: skye dgu thams cad kyi bya ba thams cad la the tshom shin tu gcod pa dang / sbyin bsreg yongs su bzung zhing sbyin pa yongs su sbyong bas bsod nams rmad du byung ba dang / phyir @325a *//
translated: the perfection that cuts through all doubts about all activities of all beings, the perfection of the marvelous merit of taking up and purifying generosity,

original: mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo la rab tu gzhog pa'i phyir /🔽thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du skal pa shin tu mnyam par 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad khams gsum las bsgral ba'i phyir /🔽ye shes shin tu rnam par dag par byed pa yin /
analyzed: mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo la rab tu gzhog pa'i phyir / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du skal pa shin tu mnyam par 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad khams gsum las bsgral ba'i phyir / ye shes shin tu rnam par dag par byed pa yin /
translated: and the perfection that establishes all beings in the irreversible wheel.🔽It is the perfection that purifies the wisdom of omniscience,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la sems can rnams dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la sems can rnams dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: and the perfection that establishes all beings in the wisdom of omniscience.

original: chos kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba dam par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba dam par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: He becomes a supreme turner of the wheel of the Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyi mchos kyi dbyings rnam par phye ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyi mchos kyi dbyings rnam par phye ba ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is the natural opening of the realm of phenomena.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: It is inconceivable.

original: tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba'o //
translated: It is the purification of the bodhisattva conduct.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir ye shes sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir ye shes sbyong ba'o //
translated: It is the purification of wisdom for omniscience.

original: yongs su 'dul bas sems can sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dul bas sems can sbyong ba'o //
translated: It is the purification of beings through discipline.

original: yongs su bsngo bas zhi ba sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo bas zhi ba sbyong ba'o //
translated: It is the purification of peace through dedication.

original: rab tu gzhog pas chos sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu gzhog pas chos sbyong ba'o //
translated: It is the purification of the Dharma through application.

original: zhum pa med pas mi 'jigs pa sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: zhum pa med pas mi 'jigs pa sbyong ba'o //
translated: It is the purification of fearlessness through being undaunted.

original: rab tu bstan pas tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu bstan pas tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa sbyong ba'o //
translated: It is the purification of the knowledge of distinctions through teaching.

original: shin tu bstan pa mchos sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu bstan pa mchos sbyong ba'o //
translated: It is the purification of the Dharma through teaching well.

original: chos thams cad las phyir mi ldog par gzungs sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad las phyir mi ldog par gzungs sbyong ba'o //
translated: It is the purification of the dhāraṇīs that do not turn away from any Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'byung ba thams cad kyi don du sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'byung ba thams cad kyi don du sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa sbyong ba'o //
translated: He purifies the teachings of the Buddha for the sake of the appearance of all the Buddhas.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa ni yon tan 'di dag dang / gzhan yang yongs su dag pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa ni yon tan 'di dag dang / gzhan yang yongs su dag pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: “The bodhisattva who is established in this samādhi obtains these qualities and also obtains another trillion qualities that are pure and inexpressible.”

original: ting nge 'dzin chen po'i dkyil 'khor 'di dag gi dbang dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu'i stobs dang / ye shes @325b kyi sa'i sgrol ba'i mthu dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi nye bar bstan pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin chen po'i dkyil 'khor 'di dag gi dbang dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu'i stobs dang / ye shes @325b kyi sa'i sgrol ba'i mthu dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi nye bar bstan pa'i stobs dang /
translated: “This is the power of the maṇḍala of the great samādhi, the blessing of all the buddhas, the power of the cause of one’s own roots of merit, the power of the liberation of the stage of wisdom, and the power of the instruction of the kalyāṇamitras.

original: bdud kyi las thams cad rab tu 'joms pa'i mthu dang / dge ba'i las skal ba mnyam pa rnams kyi gzhung gcig pa'i mthu dang / smon lam rnams kyi dag pa'i stobs dang / ji ltar bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su grub pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: bdud kyi las thams cad rab tu 'joms pa'i mthu dang / dge ba'i las skal ba mnyam pa rnams kyi gzhung gcig pa'i mthu dang / smon lam rnams kyi dag pa'i stobs dang / ji ltar bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su grub pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power to completely overcome all the works of Mara, the power of the same scriptural tradition of virtuous karma, the power of pure aspiration, the power of the accomplishment of roots of virtue as they are generated,🔽and the power of the inexhaustible and invincible merit that is beyond the world.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsod nams thub pa med cing zad mi shes pa'i mthus de ltar snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa ni yon tan mtshungs pa mnyam pa bcus sangs rgyas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad dang mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsod nams thub pa med cing zad mi shes pa'i mthus de ltar snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa ni yon tan mtshungs pa mnyam pa bcus sangs rgyas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad dang mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin te /
translated: In this way, abiding in meditative absorption, he is equal to all the buddhas of the past, present, and future in ten ways.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are these ten?

original: 'di ltar gzugs dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po sna tshogs kyis byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po sna tshogs kyis byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva is equal to them in terms of form, marks, and various excellent signs.

original: 'od dang 'od zer gyi dra ba rab tu 'gyed pa rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
analyzed: 'od dang 'od zer gyi dra ba rab tu 'gyed pa rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
translated: They are equal in their pure radiance and the webs of light they emit.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa dang / sprul pa sems can 'dul ba'i tshul bzhin du ston pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa dang / sprul pa sems can 'dul ba'i tshul bzhin du ston pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
translated: They are equal in their displays of miracles, manifestations, and emanations that tame beings in accordance with their ways.

original: lus tshad med pa dang / kha dog mtha' yas pa dang / dbyangs thams cad rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
analyzed: lus tshad med pa dang / kha dog mtha' yas pa dang / dbyangs thams cad rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
translated: They are equal in their boundless bodies, infinite colors, and pure voices.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa byin gyis rlob cing sems can gyi las dang spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dmigs pa yang dag par ston pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa byin gyis rlob cing sems can gyi las dang spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dmigs pa yang dag par ston pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
translated: They are equal in their pure mastery of the buddha realms and their pure display of the karmic actions and conduct of beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi tha snyad gzungs dam pas 'dzin @326a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi tha snyad gzungs dam pas 'dzin @326a *//
translated: They are equal in their retention of the supreme dhāraṇī of all beings’ conventions.

original: pa'i mthu dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa'i mthar thug par gnas pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
analyzed: pa'i mthu dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa'i mthar thug par gnas pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
translated: and by the power of their memory, which is never impaired, bodhisattvas are equal and the same.

original: tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa mi zad pas sems can thams cad kyi sgra skad shes pas ston cing /
analyzed: tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa mi zad pas sems can thams cad kyi sgra skad shes pas ston cing /
translated: By their inexhaustible knowledge of the different kinds of phenomena, they know the languages of all sentient beings and teach them.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
translated: By turning the wheel of the Dharma, bodhisattvas are equal and the same.

original: mi 'jigs pas bag tsha ba med pa sengge nga ro sgrog cing /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pas bag tsha ba med pa sengge nga ro sgrog cing /
translated: With their fearlessness, they roar the lion’s roar.

original: chos dang mthun par sems can thams cad khong du chud par byed pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
analyzed: chos dang mthun par sems can thams cad khong du chud par byed pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
translated: By bringing all sentient beings to an understanding of the Dharma, bodhisattvas are equal and the same.

original: dus gsum gyi tshig gi lam la 'jug pa skad cig gi mthar 'jug par byed pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi tshig gi lam la 'jug pa skad cig gi mthar 'jug par byed pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /
translated: By engaging in the path of words of the three times, they engage in the instant of the end. Bodhisattvas are equal and the same.

original: sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul rnam par phye ba sems can rnams la yang dag par ston pas byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin /🔽de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig gis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul rnam par phye ba sems can rnams la yang dag par ston pas byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin / de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig gis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: By teaching beings the powers of the buddhas and the classifications of the domain of the tathagatas, that bodhisattva is equal to and the same as all tathagatas.

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Samantabhadra said to the bodhisattva Samantabhadra, “O son of the victors!

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de rnam pa de lta bu de dag dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de rnam pa de lta bu de dag dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin na /
translated: Since that bodhisattva possesses those kinds of qualities, he is equal to and the same as all tathagatas.

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par sangs rgyas pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called one who has attained the knowledge of the realization of the nondifferentiation of all things when he has attained the knowledge of the nondifferentiation of all things.🔽He is called one who has attained the knowledge of the realization of the nondifferentiation of all things when he has attained the knowledge of the nondifferentiation of all things

original: byang chub sems dpa' de chos thams cad gnyis pa dang / gnyis ma yin pa la mkhas pas rnam pa tha dad pa'i rgyud la 'jug cing chos gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa mkhas pa la gnas pas de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de chos thams cad gnyis pa dang / gnyis ma yin pa la mkhas pas rnam pa tha dad pa'i rgyud la 'jug cing chos gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa mkhas pa la gnas pas de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva, skilled in the non-duality and non-differentiation of all things, enters into the stream of the different aspects, and, skilled in the succession of the one thing after another, abides in the succession of the one thing after another. Therefore he is called a bodhisattva.

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' de kun tu gzigs pa'i yul ye shes kyi sgos khong du chud par gyur pa de'i tshe kun tu gzigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' de kun tu gzigs pa'i yul ye shes kyi sgos khong du chud par gyur pa de'i tshe kun tu gzigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the bodhisattva has penetrated the domain of the vision of wisdom, then he is called the one who has the vision.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de kun tu gzigs pa'i yul mngon par sgrub cing sems dang ye shes sems skad cig tu rnam par 'phel bas yongs su skyo bar mi byed pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de kun tu gzigs pa'i yul mngon par sgrub cing sems dang ye shes sems skad cig tu rnam par 'phel bas yongs su skyo bar mi byed pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva, having accomplished the domain of the vision, does not become weary, because his mind and wisdom increase from moment to moment. Therefore he is called a bodhisattva.

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' de chos snang ba'i sgo thams @327b cad kyis snang bar byed cing /
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' de chos snang ba'i sgo thams @327b cad kyis snang bar byed cing /

original: mun pa med pa'i sa la gnas pa de'i tshe bsgribs pa med par gzigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mun pa med pa'i sa la gnas pa de'i tshe bsgribs pa med par gzigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and abides in the stage of the absence of darkness, then he is called the one who has the vision of the absence of obscurations.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes ston pa'i don du sangs rgyas rjes su dran pas de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //

translated: For the sake of demonstrating unobstructed knowledge, the bodhisattva recollects the Buddha. Therefore he is called a bodhisattva.

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' des de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshul mngon par khong du chud par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' des de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshul mngon par khong du chud par gyur pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya'o //

original: byang chub sems dpa' de de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshul mngon par sangs rgyas pa la spyod cing rtog la khong du chud pas de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //

translated: The bodhisattva practices, investigates, and understands the principle of the Tathāgatas’ knowledge. Therefore he is called a bodhisattva.

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' de de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas la spyod cing /
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' de de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas la spyod cing /
translated: When the bodhisattva practices the state of the Tathāgatas🔽and becomes nondual with all the Tathāgatas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mi gnyis par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mi gnyis par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: then

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang mi gnyis pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang mi gnyis pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called “non-dual with all the Buddhas of the past, present, and future.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' de de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku thob par bya ba'i phyir bdag yongs su sbyong zhing rnam par sgom pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku thob par bya ba'i phyir bdag yongs su sbyong zhing rnam par sgom pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: “Bodhisattva” is a name for the one who is purifying and cultivating himself in order to attain the body of the Tathāgata.

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' de 'gro ba thams cad du gnas pa'i yang dag pa'i mtha' khong du chud par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' de 'gro ba thams cad du gnas pa'i yang dag pa'i mtha' khong du chud par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the Bodhisattva has penetrated the reality-limit which is present in all migrations,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: he is called “one who knows the reality-limit.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' de gnas pa'i yang dag pa'i mtha' la rtogs par gzhog cing yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi @328a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de gnas pa'i yang dag pa'i mtha' la rtogs par gzhog cing yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi @328a *//
translated: The Bodhisattva is called “one who is established in the reality-limit” because he is established in the reality-limit, but he is not one who has realized the reality-limit,

original: byed cing / chos thams cad rab tu dbye ba'i rgyud la btang snyoms rab tu thob pa yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: byed cing / chos thams cad rab tu dbye ba'i rgyud la btang snyoms rab tu thob pa yang ma yin pas /
translated: and he is not one who has attained equanimity with regard to the stream of the discrimination of all things.

original: de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore he is called “Bodhisattva.”

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' de len pa med cing 'dor pa med la /
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' de len pa med cing 'dor pa med la /
translated: When the bodhisattva is without grasping and without rejecting,

original: rtog pa med cing rnam par rtog pa med par gyur pa de'i tshe smon lam yongs su btang ba zhes bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing shin tu yangs par byed pa dang / rnam par spyong ba dang / phyir mi ldog par byed pas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang /
analyzed: rtog pa med cing rnam par rtog pa med par gyur pa de'i tshe smon lam yongs su btang ba zhes bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing shin tu yangs par byed pa dang / rnam par spyong ba dang / phyir mi ldog par byed pas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang /
translated: without conceptualization and without discrimination, then it is called the relinquishment of aspirations.🔽When the bodhisattva perfects and expands the bodhisattva conduct,

original: smon lam rgyun ma bcad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smon lam rgyun ma bcad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: purifies it, and makes it irreversible, then it is called the uninterrupted bodhisattva conduct and aspirations of Samantabhadra.

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' de chos kyi dbyings snang bar bya ba'i tshul gyis chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa rab tu shes shing mtshan nyid gcig gis chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rab tu shes par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' de chos kyi dbyings snang bar bya ba'i tshul gyis chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa rab tu shes shing mtshan nyid gcig gis chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rab tu shes par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the bodhisattva understands the limitless realm of phenomena through the method of illuminating the realm of phenomena and understands the characteristics of all phenomena through the single characteristic,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: then it is called the culmination of the realm of phenomena.

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' de phyir mi ldog /🔽pa'i btang snyoms dang ldan par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' de phyir mi ldog / pa'i btang snyoms dang ldan par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When bodhisattvas attain the equanimity of irreversibility,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rgyud nye bar len pa la btang snyoms pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rgyud nye bar len pa la btang snyoms pa zhes bya'o //
translated: at that time, the bodhisattvas’ continuum is called equanimity in relation to appropriation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa rab tu shes pa'i tshul gyis chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa rab tu shes shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa rab tu shes pa'i tshul gyis chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa rab tu shes shing /
translated: “Bodhisattvas know the realm of phenomena to be without end or middle by means of the knowledge of the entry into the realm of phenomena.

original: chos thams cad mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i tshul gyis mtshan nyid sna tshogs rab tu shes la /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i tshul gyis mtshan nyid sna tshogs rab tu shes la /
translated: They know the various characteristics of all phenomena by means of the knowledge of the different characteristics of phenomena.

original: phyi @328b ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal par skyo ba med cing yongs su yi 'chad pa med de /
analyzed: phyi @328b ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal par skyo ba med cing yongs su yi 'chad pa med de /
translated: They are not discouraged or disheartened for eons that extend to the end of time.

original: 'gro ba thams cad snying rje chen pos yongs su bskyab pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad yongs su 'grel cing 'dul bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad snying rje chen pos yongs su bskyab pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad yongs su 'grel cing 'dul bas de'i phyir /

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called bodhisattvas Samantabhadra.

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /
translated: “O sons of the victors!

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: gser gyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa /

analyzed: yan lag bdun shin tu gnas pa; mche ba drug dang ldan pa /

original: yid du 'ong ba /

analyzed: gzugs dang kha dog mi mthun pa med pa /

original: blta na skyo mi shes bar sdug pa /
analyzed: blta na skyo mi shes bar sdug pa /

original: rnam par dag pa /🔽rigs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa / rigs dang ldan pa /

original: cang shes pa /
analyzed: cang shes pa /

analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la zhu ba byed do //

original: smrel zhir rgyu ba'i phyogs kyi tshul dang / phyogs rgya mtsho sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi phyogs la 'jug pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang / @340a *//

translated: the way of moving in the directions, entering the various directions, the oceans of directions, as numerous as the atoms in an anabhilāpyānabhilāpya of buddha realms,

original: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid tha dad par rjes su 'brang bar bya bar sangs rgyas mu med pa skye ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid tha dad par rjes su 'brang bar bya bar sangs rgyas mu med pa skye ba dang ldan pa /
translated: the different characteristics of the directions, the endless buddhas who are born,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam pa tha dad pa yongs su dag pa sangs rgyas skye ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam pa tha dad pa yongs su dag pa sangs rgyas skye ba dang ldan pa /
translated: the different pure buddha realms where the buddhas are born,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyan gzhan dang gzhan yod pa yon tan bye ba sna tshogs kyis rnam par sbyangs pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyan gzhan dang gzhan yod pa yon tan bye ba sna tshogs kyis rnam par sbyangs pa /
translated: the different adornments of the world systems that are purified by the various quintillions of qualities,

original: yon tan tshad med pas yongs su rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa dag tu rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs kyis rnam par 'phrul pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan yongs su rjod pa byed cing /
analyzed: yon tan tshad med pas yongs su rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa dag tu rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs kyis rnam par 'phrul pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan yongs su rjod pa byed cing /
translated: They proclaim the names of the tathāgatas.

original: de dag tu bdag phyin par byed pas /
analyzed: de dag tu bdag phyin par byed pas /
translated: They go to those realms.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dag gi zhabs kyi drung na 'dug kyang 'di nas kyang g-yos pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dag gi zhabs kyi drung na 'dug kyang 'di nas kyang g-yos pa med do //
translated: They sit at the feet of the tathāgatas, but they do not move from here.

original: der song ba'ang med la /
analyzed: der song ba'ang med la /
translated: They do not go there.

original: der yang bdag phyin par rab tu ston cing /
analyzed: der yang bdag phyin par rab tu ston cing /
translated: They manifest going there.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi zhal blta'o //🔽de dag la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi zhal blta'o // de dag la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: They see the faces of those tathāgatas.🔽They pay homage to them.

original: de dag la 'dud pa byed do //🔽de dag la mchod pa byed do //🔽de dag la rim gro byed do //
analyzed: de dag la 'dud pa byed do // de dag la mchod pa byed do // de dag la rim gro byed do //
translated: They bow down to them.🔽They make offerings to them.🔽They serve them.

original: de dag la bsnyen bkur byed do //
analyzed: de dag la bsnyen bkur byed do //
translated: They honor them.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyang yongs su 'dri'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyang yongs su 'dri'o //
translated: They ask about the Dharma of the bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mngon par sgrub pa la yang rab tu 'jug go /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mngon par sgrub pa la yang rab tu 'jug go /
translated: They also enter into the accomplishment of the wisdom of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyis mtshan ma yang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyis mtshan ma yang rab tu shes so //
translated: They know the signs of the circles of followers of those buddha bhagavats.

original: chos bstan pa'i mtshan ma yang @340b rab tu shes so //
analyzed: chos bstan pa'i mtshan ma yang @340b rab tu shes so //
translated: They know the signs of the teachings of the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi mtshan ma yang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi mtshan ma yang rab tu shes so //
translated: They know the signs of the buddha realms.

original: de dag la mngon par chags pa yang med de /
analyzed: de dag la mngon par chags pa yang med de /
translated: They are not attached to them.

original: de dag la yang pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu thob pa yin /
analyzed: de dag la yang pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu thob pa yin /
translated: They have attained the perfections.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing la dmigs pas bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis 'gro yang 'gro ba dang; sangs rgyas blta ba'i rnam par dmigs pa mthar thug pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing la dmigs pas bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis 'gro yang 'gro ba dang; sangs rgyas blta ba'i rnam par dmigs pa mthar thug pa med do //
translated: They go to the buddha realms, and with the focus on the buddha realms, they go to as many buddha realms as there are atoms in an anabhilāpyānabhilāpya­parivarta of world realms, but they do not reach the end of the range of the vision of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las phyir ldog pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las phyir ldog pa med do //
translated: He does not turn back from going from one buddhafield to another.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal blta ba'i rgyun gcod pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal blta ba'i rgyun gcod pa med do //
translated: He does not interrupt the vision of the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor mi dmigs par byed pa med do //🔽shugs la nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor mi dmigs par byed pa med do // shugs la nyams pa med do //
translated: He does not fail to enter the assemblies of the Tathagatas.🔽He does not fail to be in the presence of the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su dri ba'i rgyun gcod pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su dri ba'i rgyun gcod pa med do //
translated: He does not fail to ask about the Buddha-qualities.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos btsal bas yongs su yi 'chad pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos btsal bas yongs su yi 'chad pa med do //
translated: He does not fail to seek the Buddha-qualities.

original: smon lam gyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa kun tu bzang po'i smon lam gyi yongs su rdzogs par bya ba sangs rgyas kyi rigs 'byams klas pa tshad med pa'i don du zhugs pa las phyir ldog pa med do //
analyzed: smon lam gyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa kun tu bzang po'i smon lam gyi yongs su rdzogs par bya ba sangs rgyas kyi rigs 'byams klas pa tshad med pa'i don du zhugs pa las phyir ldog pa med do //
translated: He does not turn back from the practice of the Bodhisattva, which is endowed with the special vows, and which is the fulfillment of the vow of Samantabhadra, in order to enter into the infinite meaning of the boundless lineage of the Buddhas.

original: phyogs thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud pa dag tu 'gro zhing yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: phyogs thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud pa dag tu 'gro zhing yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba la thogs pa med do //
translated: They go to and enter all the buddha-fields of the ten directions that are known to the tathagatas.

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /🔽'di ni byang chub sems dpa' @341a *//
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' @341a *//
translated: “O children of the Victorious Ones,

original: sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dngos po med pa la gnas shing mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du 'gro ba'i ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa ste drug pa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dngos po med pa la gnas shing mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du 'gro ba'i ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa ste drug pa'o //
translated: this is the sixth superknowledge of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, the knowledge of the miraculous powers of non-abiding and non-formation that goes to all buddha-fields.

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /
translated: “O children of the Victorious Ones,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi skad sna tshogs rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi skad sna tshogs rab tu shes te /
translated: furthermore, the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas know the various languages of sentient beings born in worlds as numerous as the atoms in buddha-fields inexpressible with words beyond words.

original: 'phags pa'i skad shes so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skad shes so //
translated: They know the noble language.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skad shes so //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skad shes so //
translated: I know the languages of non-noble beings.

original: lha'i skad shes so //🔽klu'i skad shes so //
analyzed: lha'i skad shes so // klu'i skad shes so //
translated: I know the languages of the gods.🔽I know the languages of the nāgas.

original: gnod sbyin gyi skad shes so //🔽lha ma yin gyi skad shes so //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi skad shes so // lha ma yin gyi skad shes so //
translated: I know the languages of the yakṣas.🔽I know the languages of the asuras.

original: nam mkha' lding gi skad shes so //🔽mi'am ci'i skad shes so //
analyzed: nam mkha' lding gi skad shes so // mi'am ci'i skad shes so //
translated: I know the languages of the garuḍas.🔽I know the languages of the kinnaras.

original: lto 'phye chen po'i skad shes so //
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po'i skad shes so //
translated: I know the languages of the mahoragas.

original: mi'i skad shes so //
analyzed: mi'i skad shes so //
translated: I know the languages of humans.

original: mi ma yin pa'i skad shes pa nas /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i skad shes pa nas /
translated: I know the languages of non-humans.

original: sems can gyi ris brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar gyi sems can gyi skad rnam pa sna tshogs shes pa dang / sgra dang / tshig dang / brda rnams rab tu shes te /
analyzed: sems can gyi ris brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar gyi sems can gyi skad rnam pa sna tshogs shes pa dang / sgra dang / tshig dang / brda rnams rab tu shes te /
translated: I know the various languages of sentient beings, up to the inexpressibly inexpressible number of sentient beings, and I know their sounds, words, and expressions.

original: rnam par dgod pa'i mkhas pa thams cad la rab tu 'jug go /🔽brda la 'jug pa thams cad rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rnam par dgod pa'i mkhas pa thams cad la rab tu 'jug go / brda la 'jug pa thams cad rab tu shes so //
translated: I understand all the ways of presenting things.🔽I know all the ways of using expressions.

original: spyod pa rnam par dgod pa thams cad rab tu shes so //
analyzed: spyod pa rnam par dgod pa thams cad rab tu shes so //
translated: I know all the ways of presenting conduct.

original: skad rnam par dbye ba thams cad rab tu shes @341b so; ;skad rnam pa tha dad pa rgya mtsho thams cad la rab tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: skad rnam par dbye ba thams cad rab tu shes @341b so; ;skad rnam pa tha dad pa rgya mtsho thams cad la rab tu 'jug ste /
translated: He understood all the different languages and entered the ocean of all the different kinds of languages.

original: de ji lta ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams la 'jug pa de lta de ltar sems can gyi khams la 'jug go /
analyzed: de ji lta ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams la 'jug pa de lta de ltar sems can gyi khams la 'jug go /
translated: As he entered the world systems, he also entered the realms of sentient beings.

original: ji lta ji ltar sems can gyi khams la 'jug pa de lta de ltar skad rnam par phye ba thams cad khong du chud par byed de /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar sems can gyi khams la 'jug pa de lta de ltar skad rnam par phye ba thams cad khong du chud par byed de /
translated: As he entered the realms of sentient beings, he understood all the different languages.

original: de la sems can gzhan gyi skad kyis rmongs par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de la sems can gzhan gyi skad kyis rmongs par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: He was not confused by the languages of other sentient beings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It was like this:

original: dper na / lha'i bu nyi ma ni shar ma thag tu gzugs rnam par phye ba'i rgyud thams cad snang bar byed do //
analyzed: dper na / lha'i bu nyi ma ni shar ma thag tu gzugs rnam par phye ba'i rgyud thams cad snang bar byed do //
translated: As soon as the sun, the son of the gods, rises, it illuminates all the different kinds of forms.

original: de nas mig dang ldan pa rnams gzugs de dang de dag mthong pas mtshan ma yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: de nas mig dang ldan pa rnams gzugs de dang de dag mthong pas mtshan ma yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: Then those who have eyes see those forms and grasp their characteristics.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang skad kyi sprin rnam par phye ba thams cad la 'jug ste /🔽skad thams cad mngon par shes pa'i ye shes kyis skad dang dbyangs kyi tshul mkhas pa la 'jug cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang skad kyi sprin rnam par phye ba thams cad la 'jug ste / skad thams cad mngon par shes pa'i ye shes kyis skad dang dbyangs kyi tshul mkhas pa la 'jug cing /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattvas enter into all the clouds of languages.

original: khong du chud par byed do //
analyzed: khong du chud par byed do //
translated: With the knowledge of the understanding of all languages, they enter into and understand the skill in the ways of language and sound.

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /🔽'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skad kyi tshul thams cad la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skad kyi tshul thams cad la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “O Children of the Victorious Ones,

original: ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa bdun pa'o //
translated: this is the seventh knowledge of the bodhisattva great beings, called ‘the skill in all linguistic ways.’🔽“O Children of the Victorious Ones,

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras dang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po; chos thams cad kha dog dang bral bar rab tu shes te /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras dang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po; chos thams cad kha dog dang bral bar rab tu shes te /
translated: furthermore, the bodhisattva great beings know all phenomena to be devoid of color.

original: tha mi dad pa'i kha dog dang / rnam pa med pa'i kha dog dang / bye brag med pa'i kha dog dang / rnam par dbye ba med pa'i @342a *//
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i kha dog dang / rnam pa med pa'i kha dog dang / bye brag med pa'i kha dog dang / rnam par dbye ba med pa'i @342a *//
translated: They know that all phenomena are devoid of color, that they are not different colors, that they are not distinct colors, that they are not variegated colors, that they are not colors that can be differentiated, and that they are not colors that can be distinguished.

original: kha dog dang / sngon po med pa'i kha dog dang / ser po med pa'i kha dog dang / dkar po med pa'i kha dog dang / nag po med pa'i kha dog dang / dmar po med pa yang rab tu shes te /
analyzed: kha dog dang / sngon po med pa'i kha dog dang / ser po med pa'i kha dog dang / dkar po med pa'i kha dog dang / nag po med pa'i kha dog dang / dmar po med pa yang rab tu shes te /
translated: He knows the colors that are not blue, the colors that are not yellow, the colors that are not white, the colors that are not black, and the colors that are not red.

original: de de bas kyang chos kyi dbyings la 'jug par byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de de bas kyang chos kyi dbyings la 'jug par byed pa'i tshe /
translated: When he enters the realm of phenomena,

original: rang gi lus kha dog sna tshogs dang ldan par byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: rang gi lus kha dog sna tshogs dang ldan par byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: he manifests his own body with various colors.

original: mtha' yas pa'i kha dog dang / tshad med pa'i kha dog dang / rnam par dag pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu brgyan pa'i kha dog dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i kha dog dang / dpe med pa'i kha dog dang / kun tu snang ba'i kha dog dang /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i kha dog dang / tshad med pa'i kha dog dang / rnam par dag pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu brgyan pa'i kha dog dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i kha dog dang / dpe med pa'i kha dog dang / kun tu snang ba'i kha dog dang /
translated: He has infinite colors, immeasurable colors, pure colors, well-adorned colors, all-encompassing colors, incomparable colors, illuminating colors,

original: yid du 'ong ba'i kha dog dang / mi sdug pa med pa'i kha dog dang / zad mi shes pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu gsal ba'i kha dog dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i kha dog dang / mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i kha dog dang /🔽thub par dka' ba'i kha dog dang / nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i kha dog dang / shin tu bsgrubs pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu mdzes pa'i kha dog dang / dpag tu med pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu bsrungs pa'i kha dog dang /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i kha dog dang / mi sdug pa med pa'i kha dog dang / zad mi shes pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu gsal ba'i kha dog dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i kha dog dang / mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i kha dog dang / thub par dka' ba'i kha dog dang / nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i kha dog dang / shin tu bsgrubs pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu mdzes pa'i kha dog dang / dpag tu med pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu bsrungs pa'i kha dog dang /
translated: the color of what is attractive, the color of what is unattractive, the color of what is inexhaustible, the color of what is very clear, the color of what is irreproachable, the color of what has great power,🔽the color of what is difficult to overcome, the color of what is not subject to degeneration, the color of what is well accomplished, the color of what is very beautiful, the color of what is immeasurable, the color of what is well protected,

original: shin tu bsags pa'i kha dog dang / yongs su smin par byed pa'i kha dog dang / 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrubs pa'i kha dog dang / thogs pa med pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu dang ba'i kha @342b dog dang / rnyog pa med pa'i kha dog dang /

analyzed: chos thams cad las ma yin pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so //

original: chos thams cad rnam par smin pa ma yin par rab tu shes so //🔽chos thams cad rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par smin pa ma yin par rab tu shes so // chos thams cad rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so //

analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so // chos thams cad brda yang ma yin par rab tu shes so //
translated: They know that all phenomena are not not without formation.🔽They know that all phenomena are not conventional.

analyzed: chos thams cad brda ma yin pa'ang ma yin @345b par rab tu shes so // chos thams cad don dam pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so //
translated: They know that all phenomena are not not conventional.🔽They know that all phenomena are not ultimate.

original: chos thams cad don dam pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so //🔽chos thams cad 'byung ba'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so //🔽chos thams cad mi 'byung ba'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: chos thams cad don dam pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so // chos thams cad 'byung ba'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so // chos thams cad mi 'byung ba'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so //
translated: They know that all phenomena are not not ultimate.🔽They know that all phenomena are not arising.🔽They know that all phenomena are not not arising.

original: chos thams cad 'byin pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'byin pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so //
translated: They know that all phenomena are not issuing forth.

analyzed: chos thams cad mi 'byin pa yang ma yin par rab tu shes so // chos thams cad tshad med par yang rab tu shes so //
